title: Copy to Import/Remote Directory Accross Network
source_tip: Add the directory to be copied (POLIKS case number).
destination_tip:
Destination directory for the copy process
(subdirectory of <Import>self._add().
trigger_tip:
When checked, further processing is triggered or
a ready.txt file is created in the import directory.
If unchecked, additional data can be uploaded
under the respective POLIKS number.
sendmail_tip:
When checked, an email is generated
after the upload to the import directory is completed.
qualicheck_tip:
When checked, an email is generated after processing
is completed so that a quality check can be performed.
This is intended for specific workflows.
log_tip:
When checked, a log file is generated.
For this, a dialog is opened after
the copy process is completed.
start_tip:
Starts the copy process of the selected folders
to the MSD import directory.
update_message: Download new version and exit this application?
destination_blocked_by: Destination directory is blocked by trigger file: #
update_error: The new version  could not be copied or downloaded
running_warning:
Copy process is running!
Really exit the application and abort the copy process?
robocopy_returned: Robocopy returned the following value (return code): #
returncode_0: No files were copied. No error occurred. There were no file conflicts. The files already exist in the destination directory. Therefore, the copy process was skipped.
returncode_2: There are some additional files in the destination directory that are not present in the source directory. No files were copied.
returncode_3: Some files were copied. Additional files were present. No error occurred.
returncode_5: Some files were copied. There were some file conflicts. No error occurred.
returncode_6: Additional files and mismatched files are present. No files were copied and no errors occurred, meaning the files already exist in the destination directory.
returncode_7: Files were copied, a file conflict was present, and additional files were present.
starting_size_check: Starting verification based on file size
size_check_finished: Verification based on file size is completed
error_sizes: For # file(s), the size of the destination file does not match the source file
error_missing: The destination file is missing for # file(s)
